body_html:
@MadWombat : re "the rest of the function based layers have limited use" - the function based layers are in fact pretty extensively used already (such as in the models repository).

The existing object oriented layers provide a way to structure your models (similar to Keras) as objects, even without the Network class. In fact, we encourage that to make models run efficiently even when eager execution is enabled
body_text:
@MadWombat : re "the rest of the function based layers have limited use" - the function based layers are in fact pretty extensively used already (such as in the models repository).
The existing object oriented layers provide a way to structure your models (similar to Keras) as objects, even without the Network class. In fact, we encourage that to make models run efficiently even when eager execution is enabled
body:
@MadWombat : re "the rest of the function based layers have limited use" - the function based layers are in fact pretty extensively used already (such as in the [models repository](https://github.com/tensorflow/models/tree/master/official)).

The existing object oriented layers provide a way to structure your models (similar to Keras) as objects, even without the `Network` class. In fact, we encourage that to make models run efficiently even when [eager execution is enabled](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/eager/python/g3doc/guide.md#using-keras-and-the-layers-api)
